subject: Football (College)
Colleges and Universities
College Athletics
Scholarships and Fellowships
lead_paragraph: The Rev. John I. Jenkins suggests that student-athletes be able to monetize their fame, with limits. But he adamantly opposes a model in which college sheds what is left of its amateur ways.
snippet: The Rev. John I. Jenkins suggests that student-athletes be able to monetize their fame, with limits. But he adamantly opposes a model in which college sheds what is left of its amateur ways.
